Legal_Issue: Whether Orange Cove-Sanger Citrus Association demonstrated sufficient use of the POM-POM trademark in Canada during the relevant period
Evidence_Assessment: Affidavit and exhibits showing sales; challenged for lack of complete packaging photos and unclear invoices
Burden_of_Proof: On trademark owner to show use in normal course of trade
Credibility_Factor: Sufficiency and clarity of sales documentation
Legal_Rule: Use of trademark in association with wares in normal course of trade required under Section 45
Procedural_Issue: Compliance with notice and evidence requirements under Section 45
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged non-use of trademark leading to request for expungement
Outcome_on_Merits: Registration upheld due to sufficient evidence of use
Review_Standard: Assessment of whether Registrar's decision was reasonable
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Hearing officer reviewed evidence after notice issued by Registrar
Applicant_Challenge: Insufficient proof of use due to incomplete packaging images and ambiguous invoices
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory: Section 45 of the Trade-marks Act
Defendant_Response: Presented evidence of sales in Canada through affidavit and supporting documents
Remedy_Sought: Proof of use under Section 45 to avoid cancellation
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative review followed by judicial appeal
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Non-use of trademark in Canada for three years
Applicable_Process: Section 45 proceedings: notice, evidence submission, hearing, appeal
Outcome_of_Review: No expungement; continued validity of registration
Governing_Rule: Section 45 â€“ Mandatory use requirement for trademark maintenance
